name: Extended Address
description: The XAD data type specifies the address of a person, place, or organization plus associated information. It replaces the AD data type as of HL7 v2.3 and provides enhanced support for international addressing standards, geographic coding, and address validation. Designed to handle diverse address formats and conventions across different countries and regions.

XAD.1.name: Street Address
XAD.1.description: Contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, and similar address information. The primary street address line.

XAD.2.name: Other Designation
XAD.2.description: Contains the second line of address. In US usage, it qualifies address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. Additional address information that clarifies or extends the street address.

XAD.3.name: City
XAD.3.description: Specifies the city, district, or place where the addressee is located, depending upon the national convention for formatting addresses for postal usage.

XAD.4.name: State or Province
XAD.4.description: Specifies the state or province where the addressee is located. Should use standard postal abbreviations where applicable.

XAD.5.name: Zip or Postal Code
XAD.5.description: Specifies the zip or postal code where the addressee is located. Should be represented by the official codes for that country (e.g., US: 99999[-9999], Canada: A9A9A9, Australia: 9999).

XAD.6.name: Country
XAD.6.description: Specifies the country where the addressee is located. Should use the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 country codes.

XAD.7.name: Address Type
XAD.7.description: Specifies the type of address (e.g., home, business, mailing, temporary). Indicates the purpose or context of the address.

XAD.8.name: Other Geographic Designation
XAD.8.description: Specifies any other geographic designation that may be necessary. Includes county, bioregion, SMSA, census tract, or other regional designations.

XAD.9.name: County/Parish Code
XAD.9.description: Specifies the county or parish code for the address location. User-defined codes specific to local administrative divisions.

XAD.10.name: Census Tract
XAD.10.description: Specifies the census tract for demographic and statistical purposes. Used for population health and epidemiological analysis.

constraints.formatting: Should follow national conventions for postal address formatting
constraints.validation: Postal codes should match the format for the specified country
constraints.international: Designed to support international addressing standards
